content:
I will create a Next.js application that serves as an educational webpage for a chemistry problem. ### 1. Project Structure & File Generation I will structure the project using the Next.js App Router. - `app/layout.tsx`: Root layout with Tailwind CSS. - `app/page.tsx`: The main page that will assemble the different educational sections. - `components/`: Directory for React components. - `introduction.tsx`: A component to set the real-world context of the problem. - `core-problem-solver.tsx`: The main interactive component for the core chemistry problem, using a step-by-step guided approach. This will be a client component due to its interactive nature. - `transfer-tasks.tsx`: A component containing tabs for the near and far transfer problems. This will also be a client component. - `icons.tsx`: A file to hold custom SVG icons used throughout the app, like a beaker or a brain icon. - `components/ui/`: I will generate the necessary shadcn/ui components. - `card.tsx` - `button.tsx` - `tabs.tsx` - `accordion.tsx` - `input.tsx` - `progress.tsx` - `separator.tsx` - `alert.tsx` - `lib/utils.ts`: Standard utility file for `cn` function from shadcn/ui. - `public/`: This directory is not strictly needed as I will embed SVGs directly as React components in `icons.tsx`. ### 2. Styling and Design - **Framework**: Tailwind CSS. - **Component Library**: I'll use shadcn/ui for a consistent and clean look. The components (`Card`, `Tabs`, `Accordion`, `Button`, `Input`, `Progress`, `Alert`) are perfect for building the structured, interactive layout required. - **Color Palette**: A neutral, academic theme. I'll use shades of gray for the background and text, with a primary accent color like green for buttons, progress bars, and highlights to guide the user's attention. I will avoid indigo/blue as per my instructions. - **Layout**: A single-column, responsive layout using `Card` components to create distinct sections for the introduction, core problem, and transfer tasks. This will ensure a clear, scrollable flow for the learner. - **Visuals**: I'll create simple SVG icons in `components/icons.tsx` to represent concepts like lab work (beaker), metacognition (brain), and scientific principles. This avoids external dependencies and keeps the project self-contained. ### 3. Pedagogical and Interactive Flow The user has provided a very detailed instructional plan, which I will implement as follows: 1. **Introduction (`introduction.tsx`)**: - A `Card` will introduce the scenario: synthesizing aspirin. - It will feature a beaker icon and a friendly tone to engage the student. - The core problem will be clearly stated. 2. **Core Problem (`core-problem-solver.tsx`)**: - This will be the most complex component. It will be a client component (`'use client'`) to manage the state of user inputs and progress. - I'll implement the **CRA (Concrete-Representational-Abstract)** model: - **Concrete**: The lab scenario itself. - **Representational**: I'll include simple SVG diagrams of the reactant (Salicylic Acid) and product (Aspirin) molecules. - **Abstract**: The step-by-step calculation guided by the **F.O.P.S.** strategy. - The **F.O.P.S.** strategy will be implemented using an `Accordion` component: - **Find**: A description of the core principle (Stoichiometry). - **Organize**: A table showing known and unknown values. - **Plan**: A clear, step-by-step plan for the calculation. - **Solve**: An interactive, step-by-step guide with `Input` fields for the student to calculate: 1. Molar mass of Salicylic Acid. 2. Moles of Salicylic Acid. 3. Moles of Aspirin (using mole ratio). 4. Molar mass of Aspirin. 5. Grams of Aspirin (Theoretical Yield). - I'll use `useState` to manage user input and provide immediate feedback (correct/incorrect). A `Progress` bar will visually track the student's completion of the steps. 3. **Metacognition (`page.tsx`)**: - I will place an `Alert` component with a brain icon between the core problem and the transfer tasks. This will display the metacognitive prompts ("What principle applies here?", "How do I check my answer?") to encourage self-reflection. 4. **Transfer Tasks (`transfer-tasks.tsx`)**: - This will be a client component (`'use client'`) using `Tabs` to separate the Near and Far transfer problems. - Each tab will present a problem and an `Input` field for the answer. - A "Check Answer" `Button` will provide feedback on the student's solution. ### 4. Accessibility and Best Practices - I will use semantic HTML (`
`, `

'Correct! You applied the same proportional reasoning.' : 'Not quite. Remember the mass ratio is 5.6:1.'); }; const checkFarTransfer = () => { const isCorrect = Math.abs(parseFloat(farAnswer) - 7.5) < 0.1; setFarFeedback(isCorrect ? 'Excellent! You recognized the inverse relationship (Pâ‚Vâ‚ = Pâ‚‚Vâ‚‚).' : 'Check your calculation. As pressure doubles, what happens to volume?'); }; return (

Problem: Ammonia Synthesis

In the synthesis of ammonia (NHâ‚ƒ), 4.0 g of hydrogen (Hâ‚‚) reacts completely. The mass ratio of ammonia produced to hydrogen used is approximately 5.6:1. How much ammonia will be formed?

Problem: Gas Law Application

A sample of gas has a volume of 15.0 L at a pressure of 1.5 atm. If the pressure is increased to 3.0 atm while keeping the temperature constant, what is the new volume? (Hint: This follows Boyle's Law)

); } ``` ```tsx file="components/icons.tsx" // This file contains custom SVG icons for the application. export const BeakerIcon = (props: React.SVGProps) => ( ); export const StudentScientistIcon = (props: React.SVGProps) => ( ); export const BrainCircuitIcon = (props: React.SVGProps) => ( ); export const SalicylicAcidIcon = (props: React.SVGProps) => ( ); export const AspirinIcon = (props: React.SVGProps) => ( ); ``` ```ts file="lib/utils.ts" import { type ClassValue, clsx } from "clsx" import { twMerge } from "tailwind-merge" export function cn(...inputs: ClassValue[]) { return twMerge(clsx(inputs)) } ``` **Note**: The following `components/ui` files are standard shadcn/ui components. You can generate them with the `npx shadcn-ui@latest add ...` command mentioned at the start of the code block. I am including them for completeness. ```tsx file="components/ui/card.tsx" import * as React from "react" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" const Card = React.forwardRef< HTMLDivElement, React.HTMLAttributes >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
)) Card.displayName = "Card" const CardHeader = React.forwardRef< HTMLDivElement, React.HTMLAttributes >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
)) CardHeader.displayName = "CardHeader" const CardTitle = React.forwardRef< HTMLParagraphElement, React.HTMLAttributes >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (

)) CardTitle.displayName = "CardTitle" const CardDescription = React.forwardRef< HTMLParagraphElement, React.HTMLAttributes >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (

)) CardDescription.displayName = "CardDescription" const CardContent = React.forwardRef< HTMLDivElement, React.HTMLAttributes >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (

)) CardContent.displayName = "CardContent" const CardFooter = React.forwardRef< HTMLDivElement, React.HTMLAttributes >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
)) CardFooter.displayName = "CardFooter" export { Card, CardHeader, CardFooter, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent } ``` ```tsx file="components/ui/button.tsx" import * as React from "react" import { Slot } from "@radix-ui/react-slot" import { cva, type VariantProps } from "class-variance-authority" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" const buttonVariants = cva( "inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap rounded-md text-sm font-medium transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-1 focus-visible:ring-ring disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50", { variants: { variant: { default: "bg-primary text-primary-foreground shadow hover:bg-primary/90", destructive: "bg-destructive text-destructive-foreground shadow-sm hover:bg-destructive/90", outline: "border border-input bg-background shadow-sm hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground", secondary: "bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground shadow-sm hover:bg-secondary/80", ghost: "hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground", link: "text-primary underline-offset-4 hover:underline", }, size: { default: "h-9 px-4 py-2", sm: "h-8 rounded-md px-3 text-xs", lg: "h-10 rounded-md px-8", icon: "h-9 w-9", }, }, defaultVariants: { variant: "default", size: "default", }, } ) export interface ButtonProps extends React.ButtonHTMLAttributes, VariantProps { asChild?: boolean } const Button = React.forwardRef( ({ className, variant, size, asChild = false, ...props }, ref) => { const Comp = asChild ? Slot : "button" return ( ) } ) Button.displayName = "Button" export { Button, buttonVariants } ``` ```tsx file="components/ui/tabs.tsx" "use client" import * as React from "react" import * as TabsPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-tabs" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" const Tabs = TabsPrimitive.Root const TabsList = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => ( )) TabsList.displayName = TabsPrimitive.List.displayName const TabsTrigger = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => ( )) TabsTrigger.displayName = TabsPrimitive.Trigger.displayName const TabsContent = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => ( )) TabsContent.displayName = TabsPrimitive.Content.displayName export { Tabs, TabsList, TabsTrigger, TabsContent } ``` ```tsx file="components/ui/accordion.tsx" "use client" import * as React from "react" import * as AccordionPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-accordion" import { ChevronDownIcon } from "@radix-ui/react-icons" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" const Accordion = AccordionPrimitive.Root const AccordionItem = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => ( )) AccordionItem.displayName = "AccordionItem" const AccordionTrigger = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => ( svg]:rotate-180", className )} {...props} > {children} )) AccordionTrigger.displayName = AccordionPrimitive.Trigger.displayName const AccordionContent = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => (
{children}
 )) AccordionContent.displayName = AccordionPrimitive.Content.displayName export { Accordion, AccordionItem, AccordionTrigger, AccordionContent } ``` ```tsx file="components/ui/input.tsx" import * as React from "react" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" export interface InputProps extends React.InputHTMLAttributes {} const Input = React.forwardRef( ({ className, type, ...props }, ref) => { return ( ) } ) Input.displayName = "Input" export { Input } ``` ```tsx file="components/ui/progress.tsx" "use client" import * as React from "react" import * as ProgressPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-progress" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" const Progress = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, value, ...props }, ref) => ( )) Progress.displayName = ProgressPrimitive.Root.displayName export { Progress } ``` ```tsx file="components/ui/separator.tsx" "use client" import * as React from "react" import * as SeparatorPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-separator" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" const Separator = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >( ( { className, orientation = "horizontal", decorative = true, ...props }, ref ) => ( ) ) Separator.displayName = SeparatorPrimitive.Root.displayName export { Separator } ``` ```tsx file="components/ui/alert.tsx" import * as React from "react" import { cva, type VariantProps } from "class-variance-authority" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" const alertVariants = cva( "relative w-full rounded-lg border p-4 [&>svg~*]:pl-7 [&>svg+div]:translate-y-[-3px] [&>svg]:absolute [&>svg]:left-4 [&>svg]:top-4 [&>svg]:text-foreground", { variants: { variant: { default: "bg-background text-foreground", destructive: "border-destructive/50 text-destructive dark:border-destructive [&>svg]:text-destructive", }, }, defaultVariants: { variant: "default", }, } ) const Alert = React.forwardRef< HTMLDivElement, React.HTMLAttributes & VariantProps >(({ className, variant, ...props }, ref) => (
)) Alert.displayName = "Alert" const AlertTitle = React.forwardRef< HTMLParagraphElement, React.HTMLAttributes >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
)) AlertTitle.displayName = "AlertTitle" const AlertDescription = React.forwardRef< HTMLParagraphElement, React.HTMLAttributes >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
)) AlertDescription.displayName = "AlertDescription" export { Alert, AlertTitle, AlertDescription } ```
